## Bar charts

Bar charts are used to visualize 1-2 categorical variables. We'll explore this using the `Carseats` data set from the `ISLR2` package.

```{r}
#I message: false

library(ISLR2)
library(tidyverse)
```

Use the `data()` command to see all available datasets

```{r}
glimpse(Carseats)
```

Let's consider `ShelveLoc` and `US`.

```{r}
ggplot(Carseats, aes(x = ShelveLoc,
                     fill = US)) + 
  geom_bar()
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Dark2")
```

This plot stresses the relative counts of the `ShelveLoc` variable. It also shows `US`, but the relative proprotions aren't so clear. We can flip the variables to reverse this:

```{r}
ggplot(Carseats, aes(fill = ShelveLoc,
                     x = US)) + 
  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Dark2")
```

Check out the help file for more options. `?geom_bar`.
